page.title: 17PUBLIC HALLS
page.content: FUND RAISING FOR CROWLE COMMUNITY HALL BEGAN ABOUT FIFTEEN YEARS AGO AND MUCH OF THE MONEY TO BUILD IT WAS RAISED BY LOCAL ORGANISATIONS. THE HALL COMPRISES A STAGE, DRESSING ROOMS, AND A SMALL ROOM AND A KITCHEN AND IS IN REGULAR USE. IT IS USED BY MANY LOCAL ORGANISATIONS FOR MEETINGS, PLAYS, SHOWS, PARTIES, DISCOS AND DANCES. ONCE A WEEK A BINGO SESSION IS HELD THERE TO RAISE FUNDS FOR THE HALL. ANOTHER ANNUAL EVENT IS THE TOY FAIR WHEN FATHER CHRISTMAS VISITS CROWLE. PLANS ARE NOW IN HAND TO EXTEND THE HALL AND PROVIDE FURTHER FACILITIES. THE PUBLIC HALL IN EALAND USED FOR SIMILAR FUNCTIONS IS THE VICTORY HALL WHICH HAS RECENTLY BEEN RENOVATED. THE PAROCHIAL HALL IN CROWLE MAY ALSO BE HIRED FOR EVENTS.
